Waste generation and significant waste-related impacts
Management of significant waste-related impacts
column13: In Malaysia, Cochlear supports the recycling centre of a charitable organisation that aims to offer employment opportunities to people who face physical and mental challenges while also working towards minimising waste sent to landfill. For FY23, Cochlear's donations amounted to over 1 tonne of various recyclable materials such as paper, metal and glass, with income from recycling activities used to fund skills development programs and support services for the disabled community.

column6: Management of significant waste-related impacts
column13: Cochlear initiated a systematic Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) of the CochlearÃ¢ÂÂ¢ NucleusÃÂ®8 Sound Processor using the SimaPro modelling software, a leading science-based methodology. The LCA measures environmental impacts during all stages of the product's life. It will help Cochlear define a baseline for sustainable product innovation and enable it to make better decisions throughout the life cycle of its products.

column6: Waste generated

Non-compliance with environmental laws and regulations
New suppliers that were screened using environmental criteria
column13: In light of growing environmental regulations related to packaging, Cochlar is exploring initiatives to minimise the environmental impact of its packaging while still meeting medical device safety standards. For example, Cochlear uses recyclable PaperFoam and biodegradable packaging for all its products. By replacing plastic bubble wrap with a paper filler in shipping boxes, Cochlear reduced the use of plastic shipped from Australian sites to its regional distribution centres by 80%.

column6: New suppliers that were screened using environmental criteria
column13: Where an assessment of biological safety is required, and the regulations or guidelines mandate animal studies, Cochlear subcontracts studies to experienced and accredited contract research organisations. Cochlear's Animal Ethics Policy outlines the core ethical principles in the respectful and humane use of animal subjects when required to be used in product development and research projects.
column20: Biological safety, Animal Ethics Policy, animal study

column6: Negative environmental impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
column13: Cochlear's US team has established a voluntary environmental working group to advance its global environment objectives by implementing local initiatives focused on employee commuting, energy efficiency, waste management and promoting sustainable lifestyles. This initiative is endorsed by the US management team and supported by the Global Sustainability Team.
column20: Environmental working group, environment objective, waste management

column6: New employee hires and employee turnover
column13: In FY23, Cochlear continued to invest in its Hiring Manager Learning Program 'Hiring to Win', which focuses on removing unconscious bias from its selection processes. Cochlear has seen pleasing results from its work in this area, with females comprising 47% of all senior placements made during the year.
column20: Hiring Manager Learning Program, Hiring to Win, senior placement

column7: Cochlear takes a holistic approach to the wellness of its people through maintaining both a physically safe and mentally healthy work environment.

column13: Cochlear's confidential Employee Assistance Program is available to all employees and their immediate family members, ensuring comprehensive assistance addresses their mental health needs.

column6: Worker participation, consultation, and communication on occupational health and safety
column13: Cochlear continued to focus on musculoskeletal disorder prevention through early intervention, evidenced-based exercise programs and increased frequency of rotation through its operations to further lower exposure times to operations of a repetitive nature.

column6: Worker training on occupational health and safety
column13: Cochlear implements mandatory 'Mental Health for Managers' training and upskills the workforce by providing Mental Health First Aid training to help its managers recognise and fully support their teams' mental health.

column6: Promotion of worker health
column13: Cochlear commenced a comprehensive review of its psychosocial risk assessment, focusing on sexual harassment. In FY24, Cochlear will continue its work in this critical area to ensure that it takes a holistic and robust approach towards preventing sexual harassment in the workplace.

column6: Prevention and mitigation of occupational health and safety impacts directly linked by business relationships
column13: Flexible work is an important part of Cochlear's employee value proposition and is a key driver in attracting and retaining talent. Cochlear's Global Flex@Cochlear policy sets expectations around flexibility, with 87% of its employees saying their manager provides them the flexibility to manage their work and personal responsibilities.

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: In FY23, Cochlear's European-based professional education learning program provided in-person, virtual and hybrid training for ENT surgeons, audiologists and oral rehabilitation therapists across Europe. Cochlear held 166 events, reaching over 3,800 professionals.

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: The Cochlear Clinical Skills Institutes (CCSI) in Sydney and Chengdu conducted surgical and clinical training for professionals in the hearing implant industry. The training attracted nearly 100 surgeons from the Asia Pacific region.

column13: Cochlear's diversity and inclusion (D&I) strategy aims to create an environment where people feel safe, valued, included and empowered to do their best work. The strategy involves target setting and policies, hiring and development, training, communication, and engagement.

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: Cochlear's culture work and goals are closely integrated with its D&I strategy. The work of Cochlear's 100 Culture Champions has continued to focus on building a more inclusive workplace and environment where it ensures people are heard and differences are valued.
